headline: WHO concerned as Cote d’Ivoire declares first Ebola outbreak in 25 years
summarized_story:
By Sola OgundipeThe World Health Organisation, WHO, has expressed concern over the outbreak of Ebola in Cote d’Ivoire more than 25 years after the last outbreak.
Guinea experienced a four-month long Ebola outbreak, which was declared over on 19 June 2021 even as there is no indication that the current case in Cote d’Ivoire is linked to the earlier outbreak in Guinea.
Already, WHO is helping to coordinate cross-border Ebola response activities and 5000 Ebola vaccines doses which the organization helped secure to fight the outbreak in Guinea are now being transferred to Cote d’Ivoire, following an agreement between the ministries of health of Cote d’Ivoire and Guinea.
WHO staff based in Cote d’Ivoire are supporting the investigation into the case.
Cote d’Ivoire declared the outbreak in line with International Health Regulations and WHO does not advise any travel restrictions to and from the country.

headline: Buhari pledges to increase education budget by 50 per cent
summarized_story:

headline: Adamawa records polio case
summarized_story:
The Adamawa State Government says polio has resurfaced in the state.
The government said Saturday that it has detected circulation of vaccine derived Poliovirus type 2 case.
The state Commissioner for Health and Human Services, Prof. Abdullahi Isa, made the disclosure during the official flag-off of the first Round Outbreak Response immunisation on Saturday in Yola.
“One case of Circulating Vaccine Derived Poliovirus type 2 has been detected in the state,” he saidThe commissioner explained that Vaccine Derived Poliovirus type 2 (VDPV) is a strain of the weakened Poliovirus initially included in Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV) that has changed over time and behaves more like the wild or naturally occurring virus.
“The resurface of the Poliovirus type 2 necessitated the immediate flag-off of the first Round Outbreak Response for Oral Polio Vaccine,” he said.

headline: Edo Polytechnic sets for Tech, Innovation Day in Sept – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestThe Edo State Polytechnic, Usen, is set to organise a Technology and Innovation Day, to exhibit novel innovative tools and equipment developed by students, lecturers, artisans, entrepreneurs and other critical technology stakeholders in Edo State.
Rector of the polytechnic, Prof. Abiodun Falodun, in a chat with journalists, said the event will hold from September 21 to 23, 2021, noting that it is an initiative of the institution to provide a platform to showcase innovative and entrepreneurial output from the school and its host community.
He said the exhibition is themed, ‘Repositioning the Nigerian Ecosystem for Excellence and Innovation in Technological and Technopreneurial Advancements’, while the guest speaker at the event is the Director-General (DG) of the National Space Research and Development Agency (NASRDA), Dr. Halilu Shaba.
According to the rector, “The event will feature exhibitions by industries, staff, students, entrepreneurs, Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs), artisans, government and Non-Governmental Organisations (NGOs), and awards will be presented to different categories of winners.”Some of the equipment that will be on display include fabricated yam pounding machines, waste to wealth plastic recycling equipment and software applications, among others.
Prof. Falodun said the event is aligned with the Governor Godwin Obaseki-led administration’s mandate for institutions of higher learning in the state to deploy technology in solving society’s problems.

headline: Passenger Train Crushes Mother, Child To Death In Delta – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestWarri – Tragedy struck today as passenger train, plying the Itakpe – Warri railway on Thursday, crushed a mother and her child to death in Orhuwhorun community, Udu Council area of Delta state.
The Nigerian Observer gathered that the incident occurred at about 3:40pm in the Aragba area of the community.
According to reports, the woman, a moi-moi seller and her teenage daughter, were walking on the rail tracks when the unfortunate incident happened.
While the mother was ran over by the train, the daughter appeared to have been knocked off the rail tracks, where her body laid.
It was gathered that the train was bound for the Ujevwu Train Station in Udu and scheduled to return to Itakpe in Kogi state this evening.

headline: First Bank deepens financial inclusion with N100b facility
summarized_story:
Barely a year after the launch of the Firstmonie Agents Credit scheme, First Bank, announced last week that it has economically empowered its Firstmonie Agents with the sum of N100 billion.
For a bank which prides itself as the nation’s financial inclusion services provider and has pursued the financial inclusion drive of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) and the federal government with vigour, this may be another exciting way of matching words with action.
According to World Bank, financial inclusion means that individuals and businesses have access to useful and affordable financial products and services that meet their needs – transactions, payments, savings, credit and insurance – delivered in a responsible and sustainable way.
World Bank also notes that access to a transaction account is a first step toward broader financial inclusion since it allows people to store, send and receive money.
A few years ago, the CBN set a target of 80 percent financial inclusion by 2020.

OBINNA EZUGWUThe Network of Book Clubs and Reading Promoters in Nigeria will host first National Conference and Annual General Meeting (AGM) in Uyo, the Akwa Ibom Capital from September 16 through 19, 2021, a statement from the group has disclosed.

headline: FG repatriates 22 ex-ISIS members’ families, 79 others from Libya
summarized_story:
The Federal Government has repatriated 101 stranded Nigerians from Libya.
The individuals who included 22 family members of slain members of terrorist group, Islamic State, arrived in Abuja, on Friday.
This was contained in a statement on Saturday by the Head, Media, Public Relations and Protocols, Nigerians in Diaspora Commission, Abdur-Rahman Balogun, titled, ‘FG facilitates return of 101 stranded Nigerians.’The returnees were received by officials of Ministry of Foreign Affairs; NIDCOM; Nigeria Centre for Disease Control; National Drug Law Enforcement Agency; National Emergency Management Agency; Department of State Services; Nigeria Immigration Service and Port Health.

headline: Updated: 304 killed in Haiti earthquake, hundreds missing
summarized_story:
Agency ReportsNo fewer than 304 people died and hundreds were injured or missing after a 7.2 Magnitude earthquake struck southwestern Haiti on Saturday.
Within hours the US Geological Survey (USGS) estimated ‘thousands of fatalities’ and ‘tens of thousands of injuries in poor mountainous communities’.
Jerry Chandler, Haiti’s director of civil protection, told the Associated Press that the official death toll by 7pm (ET) stood at 304.
According to the update provided by the authorities, the earthquake reduced churches, hotels and homes to rubble.
The nearest big town was Les Cayes, where many buildings collapsed or suffered major damage, according to authorities, who said they were searching for survivors.

headline: Federal Government Drags Striking Doctors To Court

Chris Ngige, the Minister of Labour and Employment, revealed this in a letter to NARD and the Federal Ministry of Health on Friday.
“Whereas trade dispute has arisen and now exists between NARD and the Federal Ministry of Health/Federal Government and whereas efforts to promote settlement through conciliation were ongoing but had now failed.
“Further considering that the Federal Ministry of Health claims to have and produced evidence to have met most of their demands based on the various Memorandum of Action reached during past conciliations, especially that of July 22.

headline: Jebba-Mokwa-Tegina road not cut off – FG
summarized_story:

In a statement issued on Statement, the ministry described the report as a total falsehood.
” This is totally false as the recently constructed Talabu bridge along the road that was claimed to have collapsed is intact contrary to the online report”Faulting the story, the motorists flying the Jeba-Mokwa road who were interviewed confirmed that the road has not been cut off anywhere, as their movement has not been affected in any way as claimed in the storyConsequently, the Permanent Secretary, Ferderal Ministry of Works and Housing, Babangida Hussaini, assured motorists that the road is safe and passable, urging them to disregard the story and not to panicMr Babangida further reassured the public that the administration of President Muhammadu Buhari is working tirelessly to provide good roads for Nigerians, as such called on the citizens to give the government necessary support and encouragementAdvertisementHe explained that the Ministry has Controllers of Works in every state that will quickly inform the Ministry of any emergency of such nature on our roads for immediate intervention.

headline: 22 commuters killed in Jos, 14 others injured

Spokesperson of the Command Gabriel Abuh said the victims were in a convoy of 5 buses from Bauchi to the Southern part of the country when they were attacked Saturday morning.
The youth had blocked the road in protest of recent attacks and killing of locals by suspected herder militiamen in Bassa local government area of the state before the act began.

Doigo Jota fired Liverpool in front in the 26th minute, firing a low drive past Norwich keeper Tim Krul to stake Jurgen Klopp’s side to a half-time lead.
Liverpool doubled their lead in the second half when Roberto Firmino redirected a Mohammed Salah assist past Krul in the 65th minute to make it 2-0.
With defensive linchpin Virgil van Dijk back after nine months out with a serious knee injury, Liverpool enjoyed a relatively trouble-free evening.
Next up for Liverpool is a home match against Burnley on Aug. 15, while Norwich face Manchester City at the Etihad on the same day.
